column1: 1 ^ Benedíce, ánima mea, Dòmino. Dòmine Deus meus, magnificátus es vehemènter. Confessiónem et decórem induìsti, ^ Bless the Lord, O my soul. O Lord my God, thou art exceedingly great. Thou hast put on praise and beauty,
2 ^ amìctus lúmine sicut vestimènto, extèndens caĕlum sicut pellem. ^ clothed with light as with a garment, stretching out the heaven like a pavilion.
3 ^ Qŭi tèǧis aqŭîs superióra ejus~
column2: qŭi ponis nubem ascènsum tuum~
column3: qŭi ámbulas super pennas ventórum. ^ Who coverest the higher rooms thereof with water~
column4: who makest the clouds thy chariot~
column5: who walkest upon the wings of the winds.

column1: 4 ^ Qŭi facis ánǧelos tuos spíritûs, et minìstros tuos ìgnem urèntem. ^ Who makest thy angels spirits, and thy ministers a burning fire.
5 ^ Qŭi fundavìsti terram super stabilitátem suam~
column2: non inclinábitur in sáĕculum sáĕculi. ^ Who hast founded the earth upon its own bases~
column3: it shall not be moved for ever and ever.

column1: 6 ^ Abìssus sicut vestimèntum amìctus ejus~
column2: super mòntes stabunt aqŭaĕ. ^ The deep like a garment is its clothing~
column3: above the mountains shall the waters stand.

column1: 7 ^ Ab increpațióne tua fúǧient~
column2: a voce tonìtrui tui formidábunt. ^ At thy rebuke they shall flee~
column3: at the voice of thy thunder they shall fear.

column1: 8 ^ Ascèndunt mòntes, et descèndunt campi in locum qŭem fundavìsti eîs. ^ The mountains ascend, and the plains descend into the place which thou hast founded for them.
9 ^ Tèrminum posuìsti qŭem non transgredièntur, nèqŭe convertèntur operíre terram. ^ Thou hast set a bound which they shall not pass over, neither shall they return to cover the earth.
10 ^ Qŭi emìttîs fòntes in convállibus~
column2: inter mèdium mòntium pertransíbunt aqŭaĕ. ^ Thou sendest forth springs in the vales~
column3: between the midst of the hills the waters shall pass.

column1: 11 ^ Potábunt òmnes béstiaĕ agri~
column2: expectábunt ònagri in sìti sua. ^ All the beasts of the field shall drink~
column3: the wild asses shall expect in their thirst.

column1: 12 ^ Super ea vulácres caĕli habitábunt~
column2: de mèdio petrárum dabunt vocem. ^ Over them the birds of the air shall dwell~
column3: from the midst of the rocks they shall give voice.

column1: 13 ^ Rìgans mòntes de superióribus suîs~
column2: de fructu óperum tuórum sațiábitur terra~
column3: ^ Thou waterest the hills from thy upper rooms~
column4: the earth shall be filled with the fruit of thy works.

column1: 14 ^ prodúcens foĕnum jumèntîs, et herbam servitúti hòminum, ut edúcas panem de terra, ^ bringing forth grass for cattle, and herb for the service of men, that thou mayst bring bread out of the earth,

15 ^ et vínum laĕtìficet cor hòminis, ut exhìlaret fáciem in óleo, et panis cor hòminis confìrmet. ^ and that wine may cheer the heart of man, that he may make the face cheerful with oil, and that bread may strengthen man's heart.
16 ^ Saturabùntur lìgna campi, et cedri Lìbani qŭas plantávit~
column2: ^ The trees of the field shall be filled, and the cedars of Lebanon which he hath planted~

column1: 17 ^ illic pásseres nidificábunt~
column2: heródii domus dux est eórum. ^ there the sparrows shall make their nests~
column3: the highest of them is the house of the heron.

column1: 18 ^ Mòntes excèlsi cèrvîs~
column2: pètra refúǧium erináceîs. ^ The high hills are a refuge for the harts~
column3: the rock for the hedgehogs.

column1: 19 ^ Fecit lunam in tèmpora~
column2: sol cognóvit occásum suum. ^ He hath made the moon for seasons~
column3: the sun knoweth his going down.

column1: 20 ^ posuìsti tènebras, et facta est nòx~
column2: in ìpsa pertransíbunt òmnes béstiaĕ silvaĕ. ^ Thou hast appointed darkness, and it is night~
column3: in it shall all the beasts of the woods go about~

column1: 21 ^ cátuli leónum ruǧièntes ut rápiant, et qŭaĕrant a Deo escam sìbi. ^ the young lions roaring after their prey, and seeking their meat from God.
22 ^ Ortus est sol, et congregáti sunt, et in cubílibus suîs collocabùntur. ^ The sun ariseth, and they are gathered together, and they shall lie down in their dens.
23 ^ Exíbit hòmo ad opus suum, et ad operațiónem suam usqŭe ad vèsperum. ^ Man shall go forth to his work, and to his labour until the evening.
24 ^ Quam magnificáta sunt ópera tua, Dòmine. Òmnia in sapiènția fecìsti~
column2: impléta est terra possessióne tua. ^ How great are thy works, O Lord. Thou hast made all things in wisdom~
column3: the earth is filled with thy riches.

column1: 25 ^ Hoc mare magnum, et spațiósum mánibus~
column2: illic reptìlia qŭórum non est númerus, animália pusìlla cum magnîs. ^ So is this great sea, which stretcheth wide its arms~
column3: there are creeping things without number, creatures little with the great.

column1: 26 ^ Illîc naves pertransíbunt~
column2: draco ìste qŭem formavìsti ad illudèndum ei. ^ There the ships shall go~
column3: this sea dragon which thou hast formed to play therein.

column1: 27 ^ Òmnia a te expèctant ut des illîs escam in tèmpore~
column2: ^ All expect of thee that thou give them food in season~

column1: 28 ^ dante te illîs, còlliǧent~
column2: aperiènte te manum tuam, òmnia implebùntur bonitáte. ^ what thou givest to them they shall gather up~
column3: when thou openest thy hand, they shall all be filled with good.

column1: 29 ^ Avertènte aŭtem te fáciem, turbabùntur~
column2: áŭferes spíritum eórum, et defìcient, et in pùlverem suum revertèntur. ^ But if thou turnest away thy face, they shall be troubled~
column3: thou shalt take away their breath, and they shall fail, and shall return to their dust.

column1: 30 ^ Emìttes spíritum tuum, et creabùntur, et renovábis fáciem terraĕ. ^ Thou shalt send forth thy spirit, and they shall be created, and thou shalt renew the face of the earth.
31 ^ Sit glória Dòmini in sáĕculum~
column2: laĕtábitur Dòminus in opèribus suîs. ^ May the glory of the Lord endure for ever~
column3: the Lord shall rejoice in his works.

column1: 32 ^ Qŭi rèspicit terram, et facit eam trèmere~
column2: qŭi tanǧit mòntes, et fúmigant. ^ He looketh upon the earth, and maketh it to tremble~
column3: he troubleth the mountains, and they smoke.

column1: 33 ^ Cantábo Dòmino in vita mea~
column2: psallem Deo meo qŭámdiu sum. ^ I will sing to the Lord as long as I live~
column3: I will sing praise to my God while I have my being.

column1: 34 ^ Jucùndum sit ei elóqŭium meum~
column2: ego vero delectábor in Dòmino. ^ Let my speech be acceptable to him~
column3: but I will take delight in the Lord.

column1: 35 ^ defìciant peccatóres a terra, et iníqŭi, ita ut non sint. Benedíce, ánima mea, Dòmino. ^ Let sinners be consumed out of the earth, and the unjust, so that they be no more. Bless the Lord, O my soul.
